downloadTitle: Windows 365 Government - GCC Setup Tool for Windows 10/11
downloadDescription: The Windows 365 Government - GCC Setup Tool helps admins setup the use of Windows 365 features that require an Azure Government subscription.
detailsSection:
Beginning in May 2023, the Windows 365 PowerShell script performing tenant mapping for GCC customers is no longer supported.
Windows 365 Government - GCC Setup Tool performs tenant mapping and grants Windows 365 the permissions in your Microsoft Azure Government subscriptions(s) for use with specific Windows 365 features. Tenant mapping and a Microsoft Azure Government subscription is not required unless you want to use one or more of the following Windows 365 features:
  • Custom images - use your own OS images instead of the default Gallery images pre-optimized for Windows 365
  • Azure Network Connections (ANC) - to provision Cloud PCs that are attached to a virtual network that you manage
IMPORTANT: This is only for GCC customers. There is no equivalent software needed for GCC-H customers. Use of this software requires a valid and working Intune subscription and Active Directory tenant, an account with the Global Administrator role in a Microsoft Azure Commercial subscription, and an account with the Global Administrator role in a Microsoft Azure Government subscription. Some functionality may not be available in all countries. See the Microsoft Online Services Privacy Statement(http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=240296)
systemRequirementsSection:
Supported Operating System
Windows 10 version 1809 and above
Windows 11
  • Note: You must run GCCSetupTool.exe on a 64-bit computer.
  • Other Requirements: A valid and working Intune and Azure Directory tenant, an account with the Global Administrator role in a Microsoft Azure commercial subscription, and an account with the Global Administrator role in a Microsoft Azure Government subscription
installInstructionSection:
• Download the GCCSetupTool.zip from the Download Center and place it on an accessible share or local folder
  • Unzip the zip file and from an elevated Command Prompt, double click the following application:
    • GCCSetupTool.exe
  • The folder can be deleted after use
